page.title: 08LITTLEPORT FIRE SERVICE
page.content: Our fire brigade is{"retained",}which means that it is mainly manned by part-timers. It is called out to an average of{60}fires per year, normally inside the village. They are called to the station by an{alerter}which makes a bleeping noise; it has a radius of three miles. In the early 1900's they were called out by a hand-siren. The most common fire is a chimney fire, but there was once a fire that lasted nine and a half hours. The firemen get very, very tired at a fire and their eyes get sore because of the smoke; sometimes they get singes and burns. The men are trained to work as a group and it takes a lot of practice to learn the routine. They carry four hundred gallons of water in the fire engine and if that runs out, they pump water out of{hydrants}or use open water.
